Statuses

Class Status

  • java.lang.Object
    • Statuses.Status
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BuffStatus, OffensiveStatusNotPerTurn, OffensiveStatusPerTurn

    public abstract class Status
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Status abstract class. Why abstract? Don't know what type of status is applied yet, does it tick per turn or is it a one time application?
    Author:
    Kevin

    • Constructor Detail

      • Status

        public Status(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String statAffected,
              int effectStrength,
              int duration,
              int defaultDuration)
        Status argument constructor.
        Parameters:
        name: - status name
        statAffected: - stat affected
        effectStrength: - effect strength
        duration: - duration of status
        defaultDuration: - default duration of status

      • Status

        public Status(Status other)
        Status copy constructor. Used when updating and adding status effects heros to create deep copies in clone so references aren't shared in common. If references were shared in common when the duration of the applied status is changed the duration of the status effect applied by a hero's ability would also be changed.
        Parameters:
        other: - Status to copy

    • Method Detail

      • addStatus

        public Status addStatus(Hero hero)
        Add a status to the targeted hero. Clones a deep copy with a new time stamp so we can stack statuses.
        Parameters:
        Status: - effect, status to add to this character

      • removeStatus

        public void removeStatus(Hero hero)
        Remove status from character
        Parameters:
        hero: - hero to remove status from

      • getStatus

        public Status getStatus(Hero hero)
        Get status by class Status.
        Parameters:
        hero: - hero to get status from
        Returns:
        Status: the status to get

      • getStatus

        public static Status getStatus(Hero hero,
                               java.lang.String name)
        Get a status from the heros HashMap by name, used by StatusItem as no new Status is created.
        Parameters:
        hero: - hero to get status from
        name: - name of status to get
        Returns:
        status to get

      • removeStatus

        public static void removeStatus(Hero hero,
                                java.lang.String name)
        Remove status by the String name of the status, used by StatusItem as no new Status is created.
        Parameters:
        hero: - hero to get status from
        name: - name of status to be removed

      • applyStatusEffect

        public abstract void applyStatusEffect(Hero hero)
        Abstract definition to be defined by subclasses depending on what status effect they apply.
        Parameters:
        hero: - hero to apply status effect to

      • updateStatus

        public abstract boolean updateStatus(Hero hero)
        Abstract method to update the current status. We don't yet know what all parameters of the applied status effect, thus this should be defined in the subclass.
        Parameters:
        hero - : hero to apply status affect to
        Returns:
        boolean: crowd controlled or not, if crowd controlled must skip that heros turn.

      • clone

        public abstract Status clone()
        Clone method, since this is an abstract class we can't create instances of it. This is used in updating a hero's statuses to create a copy of the proper run type so we can still apply polymorphism. Why not a static factory method? Polymorphism doesn't apply to static methods.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • getEffectStrength

        public int getEffectStrength()
        Get effect strength
        Returns:
        this statuses effect strength

        Returns:

        public int getDefaultDuration()

      • getStatAffected
